title: Provides a premium reduction for physicians and licensed midwives who complete a risk management strategies in obstetrics course
summary: Provides for a premium reduction for physicians and licensed midwives who complete a risk management strategies in obstetrics course.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          344

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. PAULIN, BING, CLARK, GUNTHER, KAVANAGH, MAISEL,
         ROSENTHAL, JAFFEE, ENGLEBRIGHT --  Multi-Sponsored  by  --  M.  of  A.
         BOYLAND,  DESTITO,  GALEF,  JACOBS,  LIFTON, LUPARDO, PHEFFER, TITONE,
         TOWNS, WEISENBERG -- read once and referred to the Committee on Health

       AN ACT to amend the public health law and the insurance law, in relation
         to premium reduction for obstetric practitioners who complete  a  risk
         management strategies obstetrics course

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The public health law is amended by adding  a  new  section
    2  2506-a to read as follows:
    3    S 2506-A. RISK MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES IN OBSTETRICS COURSE. 1. IN ORDER
    4  TO  IMPROVE  PATIENT  SAFETY,  BIRTH  OUTCOMES  AND  TO PROMOTE INFORMED
    5  CONSULTATION BY PATIENTS WITH THEIR  PHYSICIANS  AND  LICENSED  MIDWIVES
    6  DURING  PREGNANCY,  THE COMMISSIONER SHALL APPROVE A PROFESSIONAL EDUCA-
    7  TION COURSE FOR ELIGIBLE PHYSICIANS AND LICENSED MIDWIVES AS PROVIDED IN
    8  SUBDIVISION FIVE OF THIS SECTION THAT COVERS RISK MANAGEMENT  STRATEGIES
    9  IN OBSTETRICS AS DESCRIBED IN SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION. SUCH RISK
   10  MANAGEMENT  STRATEGIES  COURSE SHALL BE SUBJECT TO SUCH STANDARDS AS THE
   11  COMMISSIONER MAY PRESCRIBE BY  REGULATION.  IN  PRESCRIBING  SUCH  REGU-
   12  LATIONS,  THE  COMMISSIONER  MAY  CONSULT  WITH  THE AMERICAN COLLEGE OF
   13  OBSTETRICIANS AND GYNECOLOGISTS AND OTHER HEALTH CARE ORGANIZATIONS.  AN
   14  ELIGIBLE  PHYSICIAN  OR LICENSED MIDWIFE WHO SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES SUCH
   15  RISK MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES IN OBSTETRICS COURSE PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION
   16  SHALL RECEIVE CONTINUING MEDICAL EDUCATION CREDIT AND A  CERTIFICATE  OF
   17  COMPLETION.
   18    2.  A  RISK  MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES IN OBSTETRICS COURSE SHALL INCLUDE,
   19  BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, INFORMATION ON THE POTENTIAL BENEFITS  AND  RISKS
   20  ASSOCIATED  WITH  ELECTIVE OR NON-ELECTIVE INDUCTION, NEONATAL IMPACT OF
   21  LATE PRETERM BIRTHS, TRIAL OF LABOR AND VAGINAL  BIRTHS  AFTER  CESAREAN

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00315-01-1

       A. 344                              2

    1  BIRTHS,  PRIMARY,  ELECTIVE OR REPEAT CESAREAN BIRTHS, AND STRATEGIES TO
    2  FULLY INFORM PATIENTS OF THE BENEFITS AND RISKS  ASSOCIATED  WITH  THEIR
    3  DECISIONS.
    4    3.  THE  MAXIMUM FEE TO BE CHARGED FOR A RISK MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES IN
    5  OBSTETRICS COURSE SHALL BE SET FORTH IN REGULATIONS PROMULGATED  BY  THE
    6  COMMISSIONER.
    7    4.  ATTENDANCE  AT ANY COURSE APPROVED BY THE COMMISSIONER PURSUANT TO
    8  THIS SECTION MAY BE IN PERSON OR THROUGH DISTANCE LEARNING METHODS WHICH
    9  EVINCE THAT ALL PARTICIPANTS ARE IN ATTENDANCE FOR THE DURATION  OF  THE
   10  COURSE AND ABLE TO ASK QUESTIONS OF THE INSTRUCTOR.
   11    5.  PHYSICIANS  WHO  ARE  BOARD CERTIFIED OR ARE ACTIVE CANDIDATES FOR
   12  BOARD CERTIFICATION IN OBSTETRICS AND PHYSICIANS WHO ARE BOARD CERTIFIED
   13  OR ARE ELIGIBLE FOR BOARD CERTIFICATION IN FAMILY PRACTICE  AND  PROVIDE
   14  OBSTETRIC SERVICES AND MIDWIVES WHO ARE LICENSED IN THE STATE ARE ELIGI-
   15  BLE FOR A RISK MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES IN OBSTETRICS COURSE.
   16    S  2.  Section  2343  of  the insurance law is amended by adding a new
   17  subsection (f) to read as follows:
   18    (F) THE SUPERINTENDENT SHALL APPROVE AN APPROPRIATE PREMIUM  REDUCTION
   19  FOR  AN  INSURED  ELIGIBLE  PHYSICIAN OR LICENSED MIDWIFE WHO RECEIVES A
   20  CERTIFICATE OF COMPLETION OF A RISK MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES IN  OBSTETRICS
   21  COURSE  AS  PROVIDED  IN SECTION TWENTY-FIVE HUNDRED SIX-A OF THE PUBLIC
   22  HEALTH LAW.  THE SUPERINTENDENT SHALL PROMULGATE SUCH  RULES  AND  REGU-
   23  LATIONS,  WHICH MAY BE AMENDED FROM TIME TO TIME, NECESSARY TO IMPLEMENT
   24  THE ESTABLISHMENT OF AN APPROPRIATE  PREMIUM  REDUCTION,  INCLUDING  THE
   25  PERIOD  DURING  WHICH  THE  PREMIUM  REDUCTION  SHALL  BE  EFFECTIVE. IN
   26  PRESCRIBING SUCH RULES AND REGULATIONS, THE SUPERINTENDENT  MAY  CONSULT
   27  WITH THE COMMISSIONER OF HEALTH.
   28    S 3. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   29  it shall have become a law and shall apply to all insurance policies and
   30  contracts  issued, renewed, modified or altered on and after such effec-
   31  tive date. The commissioner of health and the superintendent  of  insur-
   32  ance  are  authorized  and  directed  to adopt, amend, suspend or repeal
   33  regulations and take other actions necessary for the  implementation  of
   34  this  act  prior  to  such  effective date; provided, however, that such
   35  adoption, amendment, suspension or repeal of regulations shall not  have
   36  legal effect until this act takes effect.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law and the insurance law, in relation to premium reduction for obstetric practitioners who complete a risk management strategies obstetrics course
